occupation: Graduate Teaching Assistant at Oregon State University
headline: Graduate Teaching Assistant @ Oregon State University | Security Operations, Threat Monitoring, Digital Forensics
summary:
Cyber security has always been my passion and I am pursuing a master's degree in computer science at Oregon State University  with Cyber Security research group to deepen my knowledge and skills in this field. I have completed coursework in security operations, digital forensics and cyber attacks and defenses, and I have published a paper on knowledge graph for client complaint management using natural language processing and machine learning during my undergraduate studies.

I am also gaining hands-on experience in network security monitoring and threat detection as a graduate teaching assistant at OSU, where I mentor and supervise 20+ students in the security operations center (ORTSOC) to perform network log monitoring and daily threat intelligence gathering. We have been successful in detecting multiple security incidents for our clients. Additionally, I have designed and developed a digital forensics course curriculum for high school students and taught the same at the NW Cyber Camp 2023. I have also received the BaxI Award for creating an Oracle APEX application for raw material tracking that is used globally by Baxter.

I am eager to apply my knowledge and skills in cyber security to real-world problems and learn from industry professionals. I am looking for an full-time opportunity in cyber security where I can contribute to the team's goals and objectives, and grow as a security analyst, engineer, or researcher. If you are looking for a person who is motivated, skilled, and ready to make an impact on the job, let's connect and discuss how we can work together.

experiences.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant
experiences.description:
Mentor and Teaching assistant for ORTSOC - A security operations center providing services to governments and colleges in need of such services.
My role as a mentor and a teaching assistant include supervision over students while they perform network logs monitoring,  performing daily security operations and monitoring as well as taking active part in client communications for the security incidents.
I am also responsible to monitor the progress of students through different rotations like network monitoring, security engineering, cyber threat intelligence analysis and mitigation.

experiences.title: Graduate Project Assistant
experiences.description:
Designed and developed a digital forensics course curriculum for high school students that consists of Registry analysis, Application analysis, Encryption and Threat monitoring.
Conducted routine threat monitoring and analysis in the Security Operations Centre (ORTSOC).
Instructor or the Cyber Camp 2023 at Corvallis Location.

experiences.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant
experiences.description:
Teaching assistant for "Introduction to Security" from September 2022 to December 2022.
Teaching assistant for Cyber Clinic at Oregon State University (An industry-educational model where the Cyber clinic is responsible to provide Security Operations Services to different organization).

experiences.title: Associate Information Technology Analyst
experiences.description:
Worked as Data Engineer and analyst for Celonis Process Mining team
Worked in Development of Oracle APEX application for Raw Material Tracking

experiences.company: Armament Research and Development Establishment, DRDO
experiences.title: Android Application Developer
experiences.description: I collaborated with scientists to learn about the mathematics of firing range prediction in artillery gun systems. I worked on delivering an android application for fire prediction systems to ARDE (Defense research lab for Govt. of India)

experiences.title: Junior Java Developer
experiences.description: I assisted in software development of a Vehicle Tracking System (Team of 5 people) and evaluated different communication and network protocols and their impact on IOT devices (Protocols studied: HTTP, SMTP, MQTT, TCP, UDP). I also studied and debugged the existing code to find efficient solution for communication between the hardware and backend server.
